display
Class ExtendedLine

java.lang.Object
  display.ExtendedLine
public class ExtendedLine
extends java.lang.Object

A line segment that will span a window of given width and height.

Author:
Sam Stokes

Constructor Summary
ExtendedLine(double wx, double wy, double d, int w, int h)
          Create a line long enough to span a window of width w and height h, satisfying the vector equation
w.x - d = 0
where w is the vector (wx, wy) and d is a scalar representing closest perpendicular distance from the origin.
ExtendedLine(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int w, int h)
          Create a line through (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) long enough to span a window of width w and height h.
 
Method Summary
 boolean above(int x, int y)
          Returns true iff (x,y) is above the line.
 void adjust(double wx, double wy, double d)
          Readjust the line to satisfy the vector equation
w.x - d = 0
where w is the vector (wx, wy) and d is a scalar representing closest perpendicular distance from the origin.
 void adjust(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
          Readjust the line to pass through points (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).
 void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
          Draws the line on the specified Graphics object.
 double getd()
          Returns the closest approach of the line to the origin.
 double getwx()
          Returns the x-component of the normal vector of the line.
 double getwy()
          Returns the y-component of the normal vector of the line.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
